name: Starter Smoothie
summary: Smoothies are an easy way to get more fruits and vegetables into your day, but calories can add up fast. For a smoothie that's only about 200 calories, follow our formula and use 1 cup fresh fruit or vegetables and/or cooked, frozen vegetables + 1 cup fruit juice. Blueberries and grape juice are featured here.
ingredients: 1  banana, cut into chunks and frozen
½ cup low-fat plain Greek-style yogurt
direction: Blend blueberries, grape juice, banana, yogurt, ice, and honey in a blender until smooth, at least 3 minutes.
facts: 213 calories; protein 6.8g 14% DV; carbohydrates 48.3g 16% DV; fat 0.5g 1% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 29.8mg 1% DV.

name: Tropical Mango-Pineapple-Berry Smoothie
summary: A refreshing tropical smoothie, full of flavor and antioxidants!
direction: Combine mango, frozen strawberries, yogurt, pineapple juice, and frozen blueberries in a blender; blend until smooth.
facts: 261 calories; protein 7.4g 15% DV; carbohydrates 56.5g 18% DV; fat 2.2g 3% DV; cholesterol 6.1mg 2% DV; sodium 86.8mg 4% DV.

name: Fruit and Yogurt Smoothie
summary: This recipe is delicious! You may substitute the strawberries for any other berries or fruit.
direction: Blend the banana, yogurt, sugar, pineapple juice, strawberries, orange juice, and milk in a blender until smooth.
facts: 146 calories; protein 4.5g 9% DV; carbohydrates 31.1g 10% DV; fat 1.4g 2% DV; cholesterol 3.7mg 1% DV; sodium 44.9mg 2% DV.

name: Razzy Blue Smoothie
summary: This naturally sweet and creamy, frosty cold smoothie packs a lot of flavor and a nutritious punch.
direction: Peel the banana and cut into 1/2-inch chunks. Chill in freezer until solid, about 2 hours.
Place the almonds, oats, and flaxseed meal into a blender; pulse until finely ground. Add the frozen banana, frozen blueberries, yogurt, grape juice, and buttermilk; puree until smooth.
facts: 262 calories; protein 8.8g 18% DV; carbohydrates 44.5g 14% DV; fat 6.5g 10% DV; cholesterol 8.3mg 3% DV; sodium 141.8mg 6% DV.

name: Mango-Banana Smoothie
summary: I love mangoes and fresh fruit. This is awesome to make and pack to have with you around town in a bottle, or just have for breakfast anytime.
direction: Combine the banana, mango, yogurt, and juice in a blender; blend until nearly smooth.
facts: 135 calories; protein 3.2g 7% DV; carbohydrates 30.4g 10% DV; fat 0.9g 1% DV; cholesterol 2.5mg 1% DV; sodium 38.7mg 2% DV.

name: Kale Banana Smoothie
summary: So good! Great flavor and not too sweet. Very filling!
direction: Put coconut water, banana, avocado, kale, lemon juice, and cayenne pepper in blender; blend until smooth, about 30 seconds.
facts: 371 calories; protein 7.8g 16% DV; carbohydrates 56.2g 18% DV; fat 16.3g 25% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 509.9mg 20% DV.

name: Lela's Protein Mango Smoothie
summary: Whip up a refreshing protein vanilla mango shake.
ingredients: ½  mango, chopped, or more to taste
direction: Blend mango, yogurt, almond milk, ice, protein powder, and honey together in a blender until smooth.
facts: 401 calories; protein 44.6g 89% DV; carbohydrates 48.7g 16% DV; fat 4.4g 7% DV; cholesterol 18.6mg 6% DV; sodium 379.4mg 15% DV.

name: Almond Berry Smoothie
summary: Almond milk and almond butter are the star ingredients in this berry smoothie for a nutritious, on-the-go meal that is vegan and paleo-friendly.
direction: Combine blueberries, banana, almond milk, and almond butter in a blender; blend until smooth, adding water for a thinner smoothie.
facts: 321 calories; protein 5.3g 11% DV; carbohydrates 55.6g 18% DV; fat 11.7g 18% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 161.7mg 7% DV.

name: Peanut Butter Banana Smoothie
summary: It is so refreshing and it's sweet and tasty.
direction: Place bananas, milk, peanut butter, honey, and ice cubes in a blender; blend until smooth, about 30 seconds.
facts: 335 calories; protein 12.8g 26% DV; carbohydrates 34.1g 11% DV; fat 18.8g 29% DV; cholesterol 9.8mg 3% DV; sodium 202.8mg 8% DV.

name: B and L's Strawberry Smoothie
summary: You'll love this icy cold strawberry smoothie.
direction: In a blender combine strawberries, milk, yogurt, sugar and vanilla. Toss in the ice. Blend until smooth and creamy. Pour into glasses and serve.
facts: 160 calories; protein 5.6g 11% DV; carbohydrates 30.3g 10% DV; fat 1.1g 2% DV; cholesterol 4.9mg 2% DV; sodium 71.4mg 3% DV.

name: Chocolate Banana Peanut Butter Protein Shake
summary: High in protein and tasty.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon unsweetened cocoa powder, or more to taste
direction: Blend ice cubes, milk, banana, protein powder, peanut butter, honey, and cocoa powder together in a blender until smooth.
facts: 561 calories; protein 30.9g 62% DV; carbohydrates 66.6g 22% DV; fat 22.8g 35% DV; cholesterol 59.5mg 20% DV; sodium 340.5mg 14% DV.

name: Blueberry Smoothie
summary: A delicious way to use up your blueberries!
direction: Blend the blueberries, yogurt, milk, sugar, vanilla, and nutmeg in a blender until frothy, scraping down the sides of the blender with a spatula occasionally. Serve immediately.
facts: 211 calories; protein 9.5g 19% DV; carbohydrates 35.5g 12% DV; fat 3.9g 6% DV; cholesterol 14.1mg 5% DV; sodium 117.8mg 5% DV.

name: Banana, Avocado, and Spinach Smoothie
summary: Quick and delicious smoothie that can be used as a breakfast or snack!
direction: Blend banana, avocado, spinach, milk, ice cubes, honey, and vanilla extract together in a blender until smooth.
facts: 190 calories; protein 4g 8% DV; carbohydrates 27.5g 9% DV; fat 8.2g 13% DV; cholesterol 2.5mg 1% DV; sodium 44.5mg 2% DV.

name: Pumpkin Spice Protein Drink
summary: Quick and easy protein drink for those on-the-go. The protein powder will keep you full longer. You can substitute 2 tablespoons peanut butter for the dates.
direction: Blend almond milk, bananas, pumpkin, dates, protein powder, vanilla extract, nutmeg, cinnamon, cloves, and ginger together in a blender until smooth.
facts: 280 calories; protein 22g 44% DV; carbohydrates 45.6g 15% DV; fat 3g 5% DV; cholesterol 6.3mg 2% DV; sodium 191.8mg 8% DV.

name: Blueberry, Banana, and Peanut Butter Smoothie
summary: This is the perfect smoothie to get your day moving, to give you a boost, or to serve as a kid-friendly snack!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon flax seed meal or wheat germ
direction: Put ground flax seed meal or wheat germ into blender to grind and further breakdown. This will also eliminate any bitterness from the flax seed.
Place the banana, blueberries, peanut butter, honey, yogurt, and milk into the blender. Cover, and puree until smooth. Pour into glasses to serve.
facts: 251 calories; protein 10.8g 22% DV; carbohydrates 34.4g 11% DV; fat 9.2g 14% DV; cholesterol 13.4mg 5% DV; sodium 132.4mg 5% DV.

name: Healthy Cocoa, Banana, PB Smoothie
summary: This recipe is ideal for a post-workout protein drink, or afternoon pick-me-up. No supplemental protein mix needed!
ingredients: ½  chopped frozen banana, or more to taste
direction: Blend milk, banana, peanut butter, cocoa powder, and honey together in a blender until smooth.
facts: 397 calories; protein 17.6g 35% DV; carbohydrates 39.5g 13% DV; fat 21.9g 34% DV; cholesterol 19.5mg 7% DV; sodium 251mg 10% DV.

name: Pineapple Cleanser Smoothie
summary: This is great for a detox cleanse.
ingredients: 1 cup coconut water, or to taste
direction: Blend coconut water, pineapple, celery, cucumber, parsley, lemon, and ginger together in a blender until smooth.
facts: 169 calories; protein 4.8g 10% DV; carbohydrates 42.5g 14% DV; fat 1.3g 2% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 301.3mg 12% DV.

name: Healthy Chocolate Smoothie
summary: The sweetness of the bananas in this smoothie means you don't need to add any sugar to sweeten the cocoa. This is my go-to for a midday energy boost and kids love it too.
direction: Blend bananas, ice cubes, milk, cocoa powder, peanut butter, and vanilla extract together in a blender on high speed until smooth.
facts: 229 calories; protein 8.1g 16% DV; carbohydrates 36.7g 12% DV; fat 7.4g 12% DV; cholesterol 9.8mg 3% DV; sodium 91.5mg 4% DV.

name: Spinach and Banana Power Smoothie
summary: A quick, easy and surprisingly delicious vegan pick-me-up that makes the most of raw superfoods and protein-rich soy. I make one of these healthy treats for myself every morning for breakfast, and it powers me all the way until lunch. I love the mild sweetness of the banana, but if you want it sweeter you could add sugar. I've also added different things like fresh ginger, cinnamon, apple, or any number of other things. Raw vegans can substitute raw almond milk for the soy. Feel free to experiment with different flavors, and enjoy the pure energy that comes from eating delicious and good-for-you food!
ingredients: ¾ cup packed fresh spinach leaves
direction: Blend soy milk and spinach leaves together in a blender until smooth. Add banana and pulse until thoroughly blended.
facts: 257 calories; protein 10.1g 20% DV; carbohydrates 47.1g 15% DV; fat 4.8g 7% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 143.1mg 6% DV.

name: Strawberry Oatmeal Breakfast Smoothie
summary: This is a fast vegan smoothie with a deep pink color and a rich, creamy texture.  VERY filling, and perfect for people in a rush in the morning. You don't have to give up a good breakfast when it's this fast to make! I use vitamin fortified soy milk.
direction: In a blender, combine soy milk, oats, banana and strawberries. Add vanilla and sugar if desired. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
facts: 236 calories; protein 7.6g 15% DV; carbohydrates 44.9g 15% DV; fat 3.7g 6% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 65.4mg 3% DV.

name: Basic Fruit Smoothie
summary: This is a great smoothie consisting of fruit, fruit juice and ice. I like to use whatever fresh fruits I crave that day. Any kind of berry, mangos, papayas, kiwi fruit, et cetera make a great smoothie. Experiment with your favorites!
direction: In a blender, combine strawberries, banana and peaches. Blend until fruit is pureed. Blend in the juice. Add ice and blend to desired consistency. Pour into glasses and serve.
facts: 118 calories; protein 1.6g 3% DV; carbohydrates 28.5g 9% DV; fat 0.6g 1% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 16.2mg 1% DV.

name: Pineapple and Banana Smoothie
summary: A gorgeous and indulgent smoothie, but totally healthy!
ingredients: ¼  fresh pineapple - peeled, cored and cubed
direction: Place ice cubes, pineapple, banana, and pineapple juice into the bowl of a blender. Puree on high until smooth.
facts: 313 calories; protein 3g 6% DV; carbohydrates 78.7g 25% DV; fat 0.9g 1% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 10.1mg.

name: Avocado Smoothie
summary: Thick, creamy,and delicious. Makes a great summertime smoothie.
direction: Combine the avocado, milk, yogurt, honey, and ice cubes in a blender; blend until smooth.
facts: 370 calories; protein 9.2g 18% DV; carbohydrates 48.7g 16% DV; fat 17.9g 28% DV; cholesterol 12.8mg 4% DV; sodium 101.3mg 4% DV.

name: Strawberry Banana Protein Smoothie
summary: This balanced smoothie is great for a meal replacement or after a workout.
direction: Place the banana, strawberries, almonds, and water into a blender. Blend to mix, then add the ice cubes and puree until smooth. Add the protein powder, and continue mixing until evenly incorporated, about 30 seconds.
facts: 349 calories; protein 21g 42% DV; carbohydrates 53.2g 17% DV; fat 8.1g 12% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 194.5mg 8% DV.

name: Healthy Berry and Spinach Smoothie
summary: This is an easy way to get kids to eat their veggies. If you want a more fruity taste, exclude the yogurt.
ingredients: ¼ cup fresh spinach, or to taste
direction: Blend berries, yogurt, orange juice, spinach, and strawberries together in a blender until smooth.
facts: 88 calories; protein 4.1g 8% DV; carbohydrates 17.3g 6% DV; fat 1.3g 2% DV; cholesterol 3.7mg 1% DV; sodium 44.8mg 2% DV.

name: Easy Mango Banana Smoothie
summary: As a babysitter, I always look for quick, easy, healthy, and delicious recipes. Here is a great one!
direction: Blend mangos, banana, vanilla yogurt, and milk in a blender until smooth.
facts: 133 calories; protein 5.5g 11% DV; carbohydrates 24.4g 8% DV; fat 2.2g 3% DV; cholesterol 7.9mg 3% DV; sodium 66.5mg 3% DV.

name: Apple Banana Smoothie
summary: Thick and healthy fruit drink with apple, banana and orange juice. The frozen banana takes the place of shaved ice and results in a smooth, creamy texture. Serve with dollop of whipped cream for added effect.
ingredients: 1  Gala apple, peeled, cored and chopped
direction: In a blender combine frozen banana, orange juice, apple and milk. Blend until smooth. pour into glasses and serve.
facts: 132 calories; protein 2.3g 5% DV; carbohydrates 30.9g 10% DV; fat 1g 2% DV; cholesterol 2.4mg 1% DV; sodium 14.4mg 1% DV.

name: Spinach and Kale Smoothie
summary: A delicious way to add more veggies to your diet! This recipe is very versatile. You can change out the greens with whatever you want. Chia seeds give you added protein and energy. Hemp seeds will give you a boost of omegas!
direction: Blend spinach, almond milk, peanut butter, chia seeds, and kale together in a blender until smooth. Add banana and blend until smooth.
facts: 325 calories; protein 10g 20% DV; carbohydrates 46.1g 15% DV; fat 13.9g 21% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 293.1mg 12% DV.

name: Kale and Banana Smoothie
summary: Nutrient-rich kale is hidden in this delicious banana smoothie. . . perfect for those of us who have a hard time getting our daily dose of veggies!
ingredients: ½ cup light unsweetened soy milk
direction: Place the banana, kale, soy milk, flax seeds, and maple syrup into a blender. Cover, and puree until smooth. Serve over ice.
facts: 311 calories; protein 12.2g 24% DV; carbohydrates 56.6g 18% DV; fat 7.3g 11% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 109.8mg 4% DV.

name: Kiwi Strawberry Smoothie
summary: Fruity goodness for smoothie lovers!
ingredients: ¾ cup pineapple and orange juice blend
direction: Place the banana, strawberries, kiwi, vanilla frozen yogurt, and pineapple and orange juice blend in a blender. Blend until smooth.
facts: 204 calories; protein 4.3g 9% DV; carbohydrates 48.1g 16% DV; fat 0.5g 1% DV; cholesterol 1.5mg 1% DV; sodium 33.7mg 1% DV.

name: All-Fruit Smoothies
summary: Quick, easy smoothies made entirely with fruit!
direction: Pour pineapple juice into a blender and add banana, strawberries, and blueberries. Cover and blend until smooth, about 1 minute. Pour into 2 glasses.
facts: 205 calories; protein 2g 4% DV; carbohydrates 51.1g 17% DV; fat 1g 2% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 6.2mg.

name: Strawberry Orange Banana Smoothie
summary: Orange, banana, and strawberries make up this refreshing smoothie!
direction: Blend the orange juice, strawberries, banana, and ice cubes in a blender until smooth and frothy.
facts: 238 calories; protein 3.6g 7% DV; carbohydrates 58.2g 19% DV; fat 1.2g 2% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 8.3mg.

name: Orange Banana Smoothie
summary: Filling enough to have as a breakfast - I recommend it!
ingredients: ½ (8 ounce) container vanilla fat-free yogurt
direction: In a blender, combine milk, oranges, banana, sugar, salt and yogurt. Blend for about 1 minute. Insert ice cubes, and blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
facts: 340 calories; protein 9.1g 18% DV; carbohydrates 73.7g 24% DV; fat 2.9g 4% DV; cholesterol 10.7mg 4% DV; sodium 90.2mg 4% DV.

name: Strawberry Raspberry Smoothie
summary: Basic smoothie made with healthy ingredients.  Choose organic, pesticide-free berries, probiotic yogurt and local honey if possible!
direction: Blend strawberries, raspberries, milk, yogurt, honey, and vanilla extract in a blender until smooth.
facts: 318 calories; protein 11.7g 23% DV; carbohydrates 58.6g 19% DV; fat 4.7g 7% DV; cholesterol 15.9mg 5% DV; sodium 133.5mg 5% DV.

name: Delicious Healthy Strawberry Shake
summary: My Mom used to make this for me when I was a kid. I loved it then and I still love it! Especially on hot days!
direction: In a blender, combine milk, honey, vanilla and frozen strawberries. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
facts: 186 calories; protein 8.4g 17% DV; carbohydrates 27.1g 9% DV; fat 4.9g 8% DV; cholesterol 19.5mg 7% DV; sodium 102.1mg 4% DV.

name: Green Monster Smoothie
summary: Great post-workout snack that will keep you filled for hours! The taste of the banana and the peanut butter cover the taste of the spinach completely. I freeze my bananas and spinach then prepackage everything for the week! Substitutions include rice or nut milks or vanilla yogurt.
direction: Blend milk, yogurt, banana, peanut butter, spinach, and ice cubes until smooth.
facts: 382 calories; protein 23.6g 47% DV; carbohydrates 55.7g 18% DV; fat 9.4g 15% DV; cholesterol 7.4mg 3% DV; sodium 328mg 13% DV.

name: The Best Post Workout Shake
summary:
This shake is delicious, filling and nutritious...a perfect drink after a hard workout at the gym. 

I've been drinking it for years. Everyone who's tried it falls in love with it. 

I drink it every morning after I finish my workout around 8am and I stay full until 11:30am.  
I use a Nutri-Bullet® as it's the perfect size and it works really well, but any blender will do.
direction: Layer protein powder, flax meal, cocoa powder, and brown sugar in a blender; add almond milk, banana, berries, and peanut butter. Blend until smooth, about 1 minute.
facts: 493 calories; protein 29.2g 58% DV; carbohydrates 66.8g 22% DV; fat 16.5g 25% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 207.7mg 8% DV.

name: Flax Seed Smoothie
summary: A basic smoothie that incorporates omega 3-rich flax seed. A good source of fiber and a quick and low-calorie grab in the morning.
ingredients: ½  frozen banana, peeled and cut into chunks
direction: Place the banana, strawberries, flax seed meal, and soy milk into a blender. Puree until smooth.
facts: 273 calories; protein 7.8g 16% DV; carbohydrates 47.1g 15% DV; fat 8.2g 13% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 121.1mg 5% DV.

name: Simple Cantaloupe Smoothie
summary: This is a very simple recipe! A sweet, healthy way to start your day with a delicious, unique flavor.
ingredients: 1 cup vanilla yogurt (such as Dannon® Light and Fit®)
4  ice cubes, crushed, or as needed
direction: Blend yogurt, orange juice, cantaloupe, and ice cubes in a blender until smooth, about 30 seconds.
facts: 291 calories; protein 13.6g 27% DV; carbohydrates 53.2g 17% DV; fat 3.5g 5% DV; cholesterol 12.3mg 4% DV; sodium 178.3mg 7% DV.

name: Strawberry Banana Protein Shake
summary: This is a healthy, versatile protein milk shake perfect for a post-workout meal, or healthy alternative to an ice cream shake for the kids. Strawberries and banana could be substituted with kiwi, pineapple, pears, mango, blueberries, etc. Get creative and enjoy!
direction: Layer milk, protein powder, ice, strawberries, banana, and peanut butter in a blender in this order; blend until creamy and smooth.
facts: 261 calories; protein 26.1g 52% DV; carbohydrates 31.1g 10% DV; fat 5.2g 8% DV; cholesterol 8.7mg 3% DV; sodium 186.6mg 8% DV.

name: Pumpkin Smoothie
summary: Be warned that this recipe is for pumpkin lovers only! I use my homemade pumpkin puree that I make each autumn and freeze in 2-cup increments, but canned solid-pack pumpkin should work just fine. If you find the pumpkin flavor too intense, try adding a frozen banana. You can play around with the flavors easily by adding some vanilla extract or pumpkin or apple pie spice instead of just cinnamon. My 5-year old and 1-year old love it as the recipe is written. Another option is to not freeze the pumpkin and heat everything through to a simmer for a hot drink.
direction: Place the pumpkin puree in a freezer bag; store in freezer for at least 24 hours.
Heat the bag of pumpkin puree in the microwave on HIGH to soften, 1 to 2 minutes.
Pour the milk into a blender. Add the brown sugar, cinnamon, and pumpkin; blend until smooth.
facts: 155 calories; protein 5.3g 11% DV; carbohydrates 29.3g 10% DV; fat 2.7g 4% DV; cholesterol 9.8mg 3% DV; sodium 327.8mg 13% DV.

name: Pumpkin Pie Smoothie for 2
summary: I love making this smoothie. Sometimes I add chia seeds for a bit of texture.
direction: Blend ice cubes, banana, yogurt, pumpkin, cinnamon, and ginger together in a blender until smooth.
facts: 84 calories; protein 2.6g 5% DV; carbohydrates 18.6g 6% DV; fat 0.8g 1% DV; cholesterol 1.8mg 1% DV; sodium 98.5mg 4% DV.

name: Healthy Chocolate Smoothie
summary: The sweetness of the bananas in this smoothie means you don't need to add any sugar to sweeten the cocoa. This is my go-to for a midday energy boost and kids love it too.
direction: Blend bananas, ice cubes, milk, cocoa powder, peanut butter, and vanilla extract together in a blender on high speed until smooth.
facts: 229 calories; protein 8.1g 16% DV; carbohydrates 36.7g 12% DV; fat 7.4g 12% DV; cholesterol 9.8mg 3% DV; sodium 91.5mg 4% DV.

name: Spinach and Banana Power Smoothie
summary: A quick, easy and surprisingly delicious vegan pick-me-up that makes the most of raw superfoods and protein-rich soy. I make one of these healthy treats for myself every morning for breakfast, and it powers me all the way until lunch. I love the mild sweetness of the banana, but if you want it sweeter you could add sugar. I've also added different things like fresh ginger, cinnamon, apple, or any number of other things. Raw vegans can substitute raw almond milk for the soy. Feel free to experiment with different flavors, and enjoy the pure energy that comes from eating delicious and good-for-you food!
ingredients: ¾ cup packed fresh spinach leaves
direction: Blend soy milk and spinach leaves together in a blender until smooth. Add banana and pulse until thoroughly blended.
facts: 257 calories; protein 10.1g 20% DV; carbohydrates 47.1g 15% DV; fat 4.8g 7% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 143.1mg 6% DV.

name: Strawberry Oatmeal Breakfast Smoothie
summary: This is a fast vegan smoothie with a deep pink color and a rich, creamy texture.  VERY filling, and perfect for people in a rush in the morning. You don't have to give up a good breakfast when it's this fast to make! I use vitamin fortified soy milk.
direction: In a blender, combine soy milk, oats, banana and strawberries. Add vanilla and sugar if desired. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
facts: 236 calories; protein 7.6g 15% DV; carbohydrates 44.9g 15% DV; fat 3.7g 6% DV; cholesterolmg; sodium 65.4mg 3% DV.

name: Basic Fruit Smoothie
summary: This is a great smoothie consisting of fruit, fruit juice and ice. I like to use whatever fresh fruits I crave that day. Any kind of berry, mangos, papayas, kiwi fruit, et cetera make a great smoothie. Experiment with your favorites!
direction: In a blender, combine strawberries, banana and peaches. Blend until fruit is pureed. Blend in the juice. Add ice and blend to desired consistency. Pour into glasses and serve.
facts: 118 calories; protein 1.6g 3% DV; carbohydrates 28.5g 9% DV; fat 0.6g 1% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 16.2mg 1% DV.

name: Pineapple and Banana Smoothie
summary: A gorgeous and indulgent smoothie, but totally healthy!
ingredients: ¼  fresh pineapple - peeled, cored and cubed
direction: Place ice cubes, pineapple, banana, and pineapple juice into the bowl of a blender. Puree on high until smooth.
facts: 313 calories; protein 3g 6% DV; carbohydrates 78.7g 25% DV; fat 0.9g 1% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 10.1mg.

name: Avocado Smoothie
summary: Thick, creamy,and delicious. Makes a great summertime smoothie.
direction: Combine the avocado, milk, yogurt, honey, and ice cubes in a blender; blend until smooth.
facts: 370 calories; protein 9.2g 18% DV; carbohydrates 48.7g 16% DV; fat 17.9g 28% DV; cholesterol 12.8mg 4% DV; sodium 101.3mg 4% DV.

name: Strawberry Banana Protein Smoothie
summary: This balanced smoothie is great for a meal replacement or after a workout.
direction: Place the banana, strawberries, almonds, and water into a blender. Blend to mix, then add the ice cubes and puree until smooth. Add the protein powder, and continue mixing until evenly incorporated, about 30 seconds.
facts: 349 calories; protein 21g 42% DV; carbohydrates 53.2g 17% DV; fat 8.1g 12% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 194.5mg 8% DV.

name: Healthy Berry and Spinach Smoothie
summary: This is an easy way to get kids to eat their veggies. If you want a more fruity taste, exclude the yogurt.
ingredients: ¼ cup fresh spinach, or to taste
direction: Blend berries, yogurt, orange juice, spinach, and strawberries together in a blender until smooth.
facts: 88 calories; protein 4.1g 8% DV; carbohydrates 17.3g 6% DV; fat 1.3g 2% DV; cholesterol 3.7mg 1% DV; sodium 44.8mg 2% DV.

name: Easy Mango Banana Smoothie
summary: As a babysitter, I always look for quick, easy, healthy, and delicious recipes. Here is a great one!
direction: Blend mangos, banana, vanilla yogurt, and milk in a blender until smooth.
facts: 133 calories; protein 5.5g 11% DV; carbohydrates 24.4g 8% DV; fat 2.2g 3% DV; cholesterol 7.9mg 3% DV; sodium 66.5mg 3% DV.

name: Apple Banana Smoothie
summary: Thick and healthy fruit drink with apple, banana and orange juice. The frozen banana takes the place of shaved ice and results in a smooth, creamy texture. Serve with dollop of whipped cream for added effect.
ingredients: 1  Gala apple, peeled, cored and chopped
direction: In a blender combine frozen banana, orange juice, apple and milk. Blend until smooth. pour into glasses and serve.
facts: 132 calories; protein 2.3g 5% DV; carbohydrates 30.9g 10% DV; fat 1g 2% DV; cholesterol 2.4mg 1% DV; sodium 14.4mg 1% DV.

name: Spinach and Kale Smoothie
summary: A delicious way to add more veggies to your diet! This recipe is very versatile. You can change out the greens with whatever you want. Chia seeds give you added protein and energy. Hemp seeds will give you a boost of omegas!
direction: Blend spinach, almond milk, peanut butter, chia seeds, and kale together in a blender until smooth. Add banana and blend until smooth.
facts: 325 calories; protein 10g 20% DV; carbohydrates 46.1g 15% DV; fat 13.9g 21% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 293.1mg 12% DV.

name: Kale and Banana Smoothie
summary: Nutrient-rich kale is hidden in this delicious banana smoothie. . . perfect for those of us who have a hard time getting our daily dose of veggies!
ingredients: ½ cup light unsweetened soy milk
direction: Place the banana, kale, soy milk, flax seeds, and maple syrup into a blender. Cover, and puree until smooth. Serve over ice.
facts: 311 calories; protein 12.2g 24% DV; carbohydrates 56.6g 18% DV; fat 7.3g 11% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 109.8mg 4% DV.

name: Kiwi Strawberry Smoothie
summary: Fruity goodness for smoothie lovers!
ingredients: ¾ cup pineapple and orange juice blend
direction: Place the banana, strawberries, kiwi, vanilla frozen yogurt, and pineapple and orange juice blend in a blender. Blend until smooth.
facts: 204 calories; protein 4.3g 9% DV; carbohydrates 48.1g 16% DV; fat 0.5g 1% DV; cholesterol 1.5mg 1% DV; sodium 33.7mg 1% DV.

name: All-Fruit Smoothies
summary: Quick, easy smoothies made entirely with fruit!
direction: Pour pineapple juice into a blender and add banana, strawberries, and blueberries. Cover and blend until smooth, about 1 minute. Pour into 2 glasses.
facts: 205 calories; protein 2g 4% DV; carbohydrates 51.1g 17% DV; fat 1g 2% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 6.2mg.

name: Strawberry Orange Banana Smoothie
summary: Orange, banana, and strawberries make up this refreshing smoothie!
direction: Blend the orange juice, strawberries, banana, and ice cubes in a blender until smooth and frothy.
facts: 238 calories; protein 3.6g 7% DV; carbohydrates 58.2g 19% DV; fat 1.2g 2% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 8.3mg.

name: Orange Banana Smoothie
summary: Filling enough to have as a breakfast - I recommend it!
ingredients: ½ (8 ounce) container vanilla fat-free yogurt
direction: In a blender, combine milk, oranges, banana, sugar, salt and yogurt. Blend for about 1 minute. Insert ice cubes, and blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
facts: 340 calories; protein 9.1g 18% DV; carbohydrates 73.7g 24% DV; fat 2.9g 4% DV; cholesterol 10.7mg 4% DV; sodium 90.2mg 4% DV.

name: Strawberry Raspberry Smoothie
summary: Basic smoothie made with healthy ingredients.  Choose organic, pesticide-free berries, probiotic yogurt and local honey if possible!
direction: Blend strawberries, raspberries, milk, yogurt, honey, and vanilla extract in a blender until smooth.
facts: 318 calories; protein 11.7g 23% DV; carbohydrates 58.6g 19% DV; fat 4.7g 7% DV; cholesterol 15.9mg 5% DV; sodium 133.5mg 5% DV.

name: Delicious Healthy Strawberry Shake
summary: My Mom used to make this for me when I was a kid. I loved it then and I still love it! Especially on hot days!
direction: In a blender, combine milk, honey, vanilla and frozen strawberries. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
facts: 186 calories; protein 8.4g 17% DV; carbohydrates 27.1g 9% DV; fat 4.9g 8% DV; cholesterol 19.5mg 7% DV; sodium 102.1mg 4% DV.

name: Green Monster Smoothie
summary: Great post-workout snack that will keep you filled for hours! The taste of the banana and the peanut butter cover the taste of the spinach completely. I freeze my bananas and spinach then prepackage everything for the week! Substitutions include rice or nut milks or vanilla yogurt.
direction: Blend milk, yogurt, banana, peanut butter, spinach, and ice cubes until smooth.
facts: 382 calories; protein 23.6g 47% DV; carbohydrates 55.7g 18% DV; fat 9.4g 15% DV; cholesterol 7.4mg 3% DV; sodium 328mg 13% DV.

name: The Best Post Workout Shake
summary:
This shake is delicious, filling and nutritious...a perfect drink after a hard workout at the gym. 

I've been drinking it for years. Everyone who's tried it falls in love with it. 

I drink it every morning after I finish my workout around 8am and I stay full until 11:30am.  
I use a Nutri-Bullet® as it's the perfect size and it works really well, but any blender will do.
direction: Layer protein powder, flax meal, cocoa powder, and brown sugar in a blender; add almond milk, banana, berries, and peanut butter. Blend until smooth, about 1 minute.
facts: 493 calories; protein 29.2g 58% DV; carbohydrates 66.8g 22% DV; fat 16.5g 25% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 207.7mg 8% DV.

name: Flax Seed Smoothie
summary: A basic smoothie that incorporates omega 3-rich flax seed. A good source of fiber and a quick and low-calorie grab in the morning.
ingredients: ½  frozen banana, peeled and cut into chunks
direction: Place the banana, strawberries, flax seed meal, and soy milk into a blender. Puree until smooth.
facts: 273 calories; protein 7.8g 16% DV; carbohydrates 47.1g 15% DV; fat 8.2g 13% DV; cholesterol 0mg; sodium 121.1mg 5% DV.

name: Simple Cantaloupe Smoothie
summary: This is a very simple recipe! A sweet, healthy way to start your day with a delicious, unique flavor.
ingredients: 1 cup vanilla yogurt (such as Dannon® Light and Fit®)
4  ice cubes, crushed, or as needed
direction: Blend yogurt, orange juice, cantaloupe, and ice cubes in a blender until smooth, about 30 seconds.
facts: 291 calories; protein 13.6g 27% DV; carbohydrates 53.2g 17% DV; fat 3.5g 5% DV; cholesterol 12.3mg 4% DV; sodium 178.3mg 7% DV.

name: Strawberry Banana Protein Shake
summary: This is a healthy, versatile protein milk shake perfect for a post-workout meal, or healthy alternative to an ice cream shake for the kids. Strawberries and banana could be substituted with kiwi, pineapple, pears, mango, blueberries, etc. Get creative and enjoy!
direction: Layer milk, protein powder, ice, strawberries, banana, and peanut butter in a blender in this order; blend until creamy and smooth.
facts: 261 calories; protein 26.1g 52% DV; carbohydrates 31.1g 10% DV; fat 5.2g 8% DV; cholesterol 8.7mg 3% DV; sodium 186.6mg 8% DV.

name: Pumpkin Smoothie
summary: Be warned that this recipe is for pumpkin lovers only! I use my homemade pumpkin puree that I make each autumn and freeze in 2-cup increments, but canned solid-pack pumpkin should work just fine. If you find the pumpkin flavor too intense, try adding a frozen banana. You can play around with the flavors easily by adding some vanilla extract or pumpkin or apple pie spice instead of just cinnamon. My 5-year old and 1-year old love it as the recipe is written. Another option is to not freeze the pumpkin and heat everything through to a simmer for a hot drink.
direction: Place the pumpkin puree in a freezer bag; store in freezer for at least 24 hours.
Heat the bag of pumpkin puree in the microwave on HIGH to soften, 1 to 2 minutes.
Pour the milk into a blender. Add the brown sugar, cinnamon, and pumpkin; blend until smooth.
facts: 155 calories; protein 5.3g 11% DV; carbohydrates 29.3g 10% DV; fat 2.7g 4% DV; cholesterol 9.8mg 3% DV; sodium 327.8mg 13% DV.

name: Pumpkin Pie Smoothie for 2
summary: I love making this smoothie. Sometimes I add chia seeds for a bit of texture.
direction: Blend ice cubes, banana, yogurt, pumpkin, cinnamon, and ginger together in a blender until smooth.
facts: 84 calories; protein 2.6g 5% DV; carbohydrates 18.6g 6% DV; fat 0.8g 1% DV; cholesterol 1.8mg 1% DV; sodium 98.5mg 4% DV.
